text: I like the techy sound of it.This is another one of my future purchases.The 3DS has so many awesome games! I'm far behind with only 5 games owned at the moment

text: Why isn't Isabeau on the cover, that's just sexist.

text: I just picked up a 3DS and I've heard a lot about SMT IV as well.  Gotta say, after hearing this track, I'm practically guaranteed to pick up the game now.  Sounds like my style of music and atmosphere.

text: I was extremely disappointed with the OST of SMT4. Especially after playing Strange Journey. Meguro really bested himself there, and I'm just glad he's back for Persona 5

text: This theme man. The composer really did a great job capturing the feel of a SMT game.

text: Funky.
author: Alex Baker

text: This is a good song, Personally I love the Tokyo overworld theme. Very good soundtrack :D
author: LordRoto

text: I just can't wait to get this game. I'm going to enjoy the hell out of the soundtrack while playing. And what I REALLY can't wait for is Persona 5!
author: SanRok

text: The very beginning was tough, but once you get your team assembled it isn't too bad. Always have every elemental type on hand.
author: Sephiko

text: Shin Megami Tensei, gotta catch 'em all!
author: Jirt

text: This is my favorite game for the 3DS and one of my favorite SMT titles alongside Strange Journey. This song flew under the radar for me the first time through Ikebukuro, but upon returning there later and re-hearing the song, it has become one of my favorites from the game. Koduko did an amazing job with SMTIV's soundtrack, especially the battle themes.
author: CaboosesApprentice

text: Would you believe this STILL isn't out in the UK? I know, I can hardly believe it myself. If SEGA don't force Atlus to step up their localisation/distribution i'm going to be one very unhappy bunny.
author: IHeart16Bit

text: Out of curiosity, how do you feel about the upcoming Shin Megami Tensei X Fire Emblem game?
author: Medal Melodies

text: Too early to tell as there's barely any info on it, but it seems very surprising and exciting. The fact that it's on the Wii U and not the 3DS is even more exciting as I really can't tell what it'll be like.
author: SupraDarky

text: @SupraDarky The fact that it's on the Wii U will surely get more hardcore gamers coming in.
author: Medal Melodies

text: +Medal Melodies RIP SMT X FE
author: LimeFroge

text: Definitely play it. It's really good up to where I've gotten
author: Bryan

text: 2013 is an amazing year for the 3DS, I really can't catch up right now. As someone who loved Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne, I greatly look forward to playing this. I really like the atmosphere in these games. I was disappointed when I learned Meguro didn't compose this soundtrack, but after listening to a couple tunes I really can't complain. Koduko probably tried emulating his sound and it works.
author: SupraDarky

text: Why does the middle character in the image have a lightsaber...?
author: Jirt

text: Love this game so much. With all of the other tracks in the game (with the Tokyo Map theme, Shinjuku 2 (non spoiler name), Battle 3 (non spoiler name), and ??? Battle (non spoiler name) being some of my favorites. This track actually flew under my radar while playing this game with all of the other Awesome VGM the game has.
author: MegaZeroX7

text: I really like this song.  Koduko did a great job at emulating the style of Meguro.  I really Meguro as a composer.  You know what I'm also surprised about?  I'm surprised that Koji Kondo isn't doing the soundtrack for a Link Between Worlds. No disrespect to Ryo Nagamatsu, but I think it would make sense having the original composer for the game do the music for the remake.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. I don't mean to be technical, but Link Between Worlds isn't a remake.
author: zeerinianu

text: the OST is still not out right?
author: 7md

text: @zeerinianu What makes you think it's not a remake?
author: Eric C.

text:
@zeerinianu
It's not an original game. Reuses old content. It's like 3D Land and 3D World.
author: ServBotPhil

text: @Eric C. Because.. it's not? There's nothing to argue about. It is in no way the same game remade nor is it intended to be. It's a sequel. It does have the same overworld though, and started life as a remake, which causes confusion.
author: Amppelix

text: Yes, what GKoopa said. There are a lot of similarities between the two games, but not enough for Link Between Worlds to be considered a remake...or at least, not a remake in the traditional sense.
author: zeerinianu

text: @Eric C. The soundtrack is closer to the SMT composer before Meguro took over.
author: Kyle McDaniel
